If  the  number[28;15Hspecified  is zero, it sets the default number of positions to one half of the screen width.  Alternately, the number may be[29;25Has a fraction of the width of the screen, starting with a decimal point: .5 is half of the  screen  width,  .3  is[30;15Hthree  tenths  of  the screen width, and so on.  If the number is specified as a fraction, the actual number of scroll posiâ€[31;16Hions is recalculated if the terminal window is resized, so that the actual scroll remains at the specified fraction of  the[32;15Hscreen width.[K[33;1H[K[34;1H       --follow-name[35;8H       Normally,  if  the  input file is renamed while an F command is executing, less will continue to display the contents of the[36;15Horiginal file despite its name change.  If --follow-name is specified, during an F command less will periodically attempt to[36;1H[36;1H[36;1H[1;1H[K[36;1H[36;1H[36;1H[1;1H       -yn or --max-forw-scroll=n[36;1H[36;1H[36;1H[1;8H       Specifies  a  maximum number of lines to scroll forward.  If it is necessary to scroll forward more than n lines, the screen[36;1H[36;1H[36;1H[1;15His repainted instead.  The -c or -C option may be used to repaint from the top of the screen if desired.   By  default,  any[36;1H[36;1H[36;1H[1;15Hforward movement causes scrolling.[K[36;1H[36;1H[36;1H[1;1H[K[36;1H[36;1H[36;1H[1;1H       -[z]n or --window=n[36;1H[36;1H[36;1H[1;8H       Changes  the default scrolling window size to n lines.  The default is one screenful.  The z and w commands can also be used[36;1H[36;1H[2;1H              to change the window size.  The "z" may be omitted for compatibility with some versions of more.  If the number n  is  negaâ€[3;8H       tive,  it  indicates  n  lines  less  than  the  current screen size.  For example, if the screen is 24 lines, -z-4 sets the[4;15Hscrolling window to 20 lines.  If the screen is resized to 40 lines, the scrolling window automatically changes to 36 lines.[5;1H[K[6;8H-"cc or --quotes=cc[K[7;1H              Changes the filename quoting character.  This may be necessary if you are trying to name a file which contains  both  spaces[8;8H       and  quote  characters.  Followed by a single character, this changes the quote character to that character.  Filenames conâ€[9;15Htaining a space should then be surrounded by that character rather than by  double  quotes.   Followed  by  two  characters,[10;15Hchanges  the  open  quote to the first character, and the close quote to the second character.  Filenames containing a space[11;15Hshould then be preceded by the open quote character and followed by the close quote character.  Note  that  even  after  the[12;15Hquote characters are changed, this option remains -" (a dash followed by a double quote).[K[14;9H~ or --tilde[K[15;15HNormally lines after end of file are displayed as a single tilde (~).  This option causes lines after end of file to be disâ€[16;15Hplayed as blank lines.[K[17;1H[K[18;8H-# or --shift[K[19;15HSpecifies the default number of positions to scroll horizontally in the RIGHTARROW and LEFTARROW commands.   If  the  number[20;15Hspecified  is zero, it sets the default number of positions to one half of the screen width.  Alternately, the number may be[21;1H              specified as a fraction of the width of the screen, starting with a decimal point: .5 is half of the  screen  width,  .3  is[22;8H       three  tenths  of  the screen width, and so on.  If the number is specified as a fraction, the actual number of scroll posiâ€[23;15Htions is recalculated if the terminal window is resized, so that the actual scroll remains at the specified fraction of  the[24;15Hscreen width.[K[26;9H-follow-name[27;15HNormally,  if  the  input file is renamed while an F command is executing, less will continue to display the contents of the[28;15Horiginal file despite its name change.  If --follow-name is specified, during an F command less will periodically attempt to[29;15Hreopen  the file by name.  If the reopen succeeds and the file is a different file from the original (which means that a new[30;15Hfile has been created with the same name as the original (now renamed) file), less will display the  contents  of  that  new[31;15Hfile.[K[32;1H[K[33;1H       --no-keypad[34;8H       Disables  sending  the  keypad initialization and deinitialization strings to the terminal.  This is sometimes useful if the[35;15Hkeypad strings make the numeric keypad behave in an undesirable manner.[K[36;1H[K[36;1H[1;15Hto change the window size.  The "z" may be omitted for compatibility with some versions of more.  If the number n  is  negaâ€[2;16Hive,  it  indicates  n  lines  less  than  the  current screen size.  For example, if the screen is 24 lines, -z-4 sets the[3;15Hscrolling window to 20 lines.  If the screen is resized to 40 lines, the scrolling window automatically changes to 36 lines.[4;1H[K[5;1H       -"cc or --quotes=cc[6;8H       Changes the filename quoting character. This can be useful when viewing a file whose name begins with a "-" or "+".[28;1H[K[29;8H+      If  a  command line option begins with +, the remainder of that option is taken to be an initial command to less.  For examâ€[30;15Hple, +G tells less to start at the end of the file rather than the beginning, and +/xyz tells  it  to  start  at  the  first[31;1H              occurrence  of  "xyz" in the file.  As a special case, +<number> acts like +<number>g; that is, it starts the display at the[32;8H       specified line number (however, see the caveat under the "g" command above).  If the option starts with ++, the initial comâ€[33;15Hmand applies to every file being viewed, not just the first one.  The + command described previously may also be used to set[34;1H              (or change) an initial command for every file.[35;1H[K[36;1HLINE EDITING[K[36;1H[1;1H       -# or --shift[2;8H       Specifies the default number of positions to scroll horizontally in the RIGHTARROW and LEFTARROW commands. The + command described previously may also be used to set[27;1H              (or change) an initial command for every file.[28;1H[K[29;1HLINE EDITING[K[30;8HWhen entering command line at the bottom of the screen (for example, a filename for the :e command, or the  pattern  for  a  search[31;8Hcommand),  certain keys can be used to manipulate the command line.  Most commands have an alternate form in [ brackets ] which can[32;8Hbe used if a key does not exist on a particular keyboard.  (Note that the forms beginning with ESC do not work in some  MS-DOS  and[33;8HWindows  systems because ESC is the line erase character.)  Any of these special keys may be entered literally by preceding it with[34;1H       the "literal" character, either ^V or ^A.  A backslash itself may also be entered literally by entering two backslashes.[35;1H[K[36;8HLEFTARROW [ ESC-h ][K[36;1H[1;1H[K[2;1H       --follow-name[3;8H       Normally,  if  the  input file is renamed while an F command is executing, less will continue to display the contents of the[4;15Horiginal file despite its name change. Most commands have an alternate form in [ brackets ] which can[31;8Hbe used if a key does not exist on a particular keyboard.  (Note that the forms beginning with ESC do not work in some  MS-DOS  and[32;8HWindows  systems because ESC is the line erase character.)  Any of these special keys may be entered literally by preceding it with[33;8Hthe "literal" character, either ^V or ^A.  A backslash itself may also be entered literally by entering two backslashes.[K[34;1H[K[35;1H       LEFTARROW [ ESC-h ][36;8H       Move the cursor one space to the left.[36;1H[36;1H[36;1H[1;1H       --follow-name[36;1H[36;1H[36;1H[37;1H[7m-----Info: (*manpages*)less, 1181 lines --53%-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------[0m[1;8H       Normally,  if  the  input file is renamed while an F command is executing, less will continue to display the contents of the[36;1H[36;1H[36;1H[1;15Horiginal file despite its name change.  If --follow-name is specified, during an F command less will periodically attempt to[36;1H[36;1H[36;1H[1;15Hreopen  the file by name.  If the reopen succeeds and the file is a different file from the original (which means that a new[36;1H[36;1H[2;8H       file has been created with the same name as the original (now renamed) file), less will display the  contents  of  that  new[3;15Hfile.[K[4;1H[K[5;8H--no-keypad[K[6;15HDisables  sending  the  keypad initialization and deinitialization strings to the terminal.  This is sometimes useful if the[7;15Hkeypad strings make the numeric keypad behave in an undesirable manner.[9;10Huse-backslash[10;15HThis option changes the interpretations of options which follow this one.  After the --use-backslash option,  any  backslash[11;15Hin  an option string is removed and the following character is taken literally.  This allows a dollar sign to be included in[12;1H              option strings.[13;1H[K[14;8H--     A command line argument of "--" marks the end of option arguments.  Any arguments following this are  interpreted  as  fileâ€[15;15Hnames.  This can be useful when viewing a file whose name begins with a "-" or "+".[K[16;1H[K[17;1H       +      If  a  command line option begins with +, the remainder of that option is taken to be an initial command to less.  For examâ€[18;8H       ple, +G tells less to start at the end of the file rather than the beginning, and +/xyz tells  it  to  start  at  the  first[19;15Hoccurrence  of  "xyz" in the file.  As a special case, +<number> acts like +<number>g; that is, it starts the display at the[20;1H              specified line number (however, see the caveat under the "g" command above).  If the option starts with ++, the initial comâ€[21;8H       mand applies to every file being viewed, not just the first one.  The + command described previously may also be used to set[22;15H(or change) an initial command for every file.[K[23;1H[K[24;1HLINE EDITING[K[25;8HWhen entering command line at the bottom of the screen (for example, a filename for the :e command, or the  pattern  for  a  search[26;8Hcommand),  certain keys can be used to manipulate the command line.  Most commands have an alternate form in [ brackets ] which can[27;1H       be used if a key does not exist on a particular keyboard.  (Note that the forms beginning with ESC do not work in some  MS-DOS  and[28;1H       Windows  systems because ESC is the line erase character.)  Any of these special keys may be entered literally by preceding it with[29;8Hthe "literal" character, either ^V or ^A.  A backslash itself may also be entered literally by entering two backslashes.[K[30;1H[K[31;8HLEFTARROW [ ESC-h ][K[32;8H       Move the cursor one space to the left.[K[33;1H[K[34;1H       RIGHTARROW [ ESC-l ][35;8H       Move the cursor one space to the right.[36;1H[K[36;1H[1;15Hfile has been created with the same name as the original (now renamed) file), less will display the  contents  of  that  new[2;19H.[K[3;1H[K[4;1H       --no-keypad[5;8H       Disables  sending  the  keypad initialization and deinitialization strings to the terminal.  This is sometimes useful if the[6;15Hkeypad strings make the numeric keypad behave in an undesirable manner.[K[7;1H[K[8;1H       --use-backslash[9;8H       This option changes the interpretations of options which follow this one.  After the --use-backslash option,  any  backslash[10;15Hin  an option string is removed and the following character is taken literally.  This allows a dollar sign to be included in[11;15Hoption strings.[K[12;1H[K[13;1H       --     A command line argument of "--" marks the end of option arguments.  Any arguments following this are  interpreted  as  fileâ€[14;8H       names.  This can be useful when viewing a file whose name begins with a "-" or "+".[K[15;1H[K[16;1H       +      If  a  command line option begins with +, the remainder of that option is taken to be an initial command to less.  For examâ€[17;8H       ple, +G tells less to start at the end of the file rather than the beginning, and +/xyz tells  it  to  start  at  the  first[18;15Hoccurrence  of  "xyz" in the file.  As a special case, +<number> acts like +<number>g; that is, it starts the display at the[19;15Hspecified line number (however, see the caveat under the "g" command above).  If the option starts with ++, the initial comâ€[20;15Hmand applies to every file being viewed, not just the first one.  The + command described previously may also be used to set[21;15H(or change) an initial command for every file.[K[22;1H[K[23;1HLINE EDITING[24;1H       When entering command line at the bottom of the screen (for example, a filename for the :e command, or the  pattern  for  a  search[25;8Hcommand),  certain keys can be used to manipulate the command line.  Most commands have an alternate form in [ brackets ] which can[26;8Hbe used if a key does not exist on a particular keyboard.  (Note that the forms beginning with ESC do not work in some  MS-DOS  and[27;8HWindows  systems because ESC is the line erase character.)  Any of these special keys may be entered literally by preceding it with[28;8Hthe "literal" character, either ^V or ^A.  A backslash itself may also be entered literally by entering two backslashes.[K[29;1H[K[30;1H       LEFTARROW [ ESC-h ][31;8H       Move the cursor one space to the left.[32;1H[K[33;1H       RIGHTARROW [ ESC-l ][34;8H       Move the cursor one space to the right.[35;1H[K[36;1H       ^LEFTARROW [ ESC-b or ESC-LEFTARROW ][36;1H[36;1H[36;1H[38;1H[K[?1l>[?1049l[23;0;0t[38;1H[K[?1l>[?1049l[23;0;0t]0;seguridad@admin1-Latitude-3490: ~/Escritorio/pki-example-1/etc[01;32mseguridad@admin1-Latitude-3490[00m:[01;34m~/Escritorio/pki-example-1/etc[00m$ info lesshelp less*less root-ca.conf 
[?1049h[22;0;0t[?1h=# Simple Root CA

# The [default] section contains global constants that can be referred to from
# the entire configuration file. It may also hold settings pertaining to more
# than one openssl command.

[ default ]
ca                      = root-ca               # CA name
dir                     = .                     # Top dir

# The next part of the configuration file is used by the openssl req command.
# It defines the CA's key pair, its DN, and the desired extensions for the CA
# certificate.

[ req ]
default_bits            = 2048                  # RSA key size
encrypt_key             = yes                   # Protect private key
default_md              = sha1                  # MD to use
utf8                    = yes                   # Input is UTF-8
string_mask             = utf8only              # Emit UTF-8 strings
prompt                  = no                    # Don't prompt for DN
distinguished_name      = ca_dn                 # DN section
req_extensions          = ca_reqext             # Desired extensions

[ ca_dn ]
0.domainComponent       = "org"
1.domainComponent       = "simple"
organizationName        = "Simple Inc"
organizationalUnitName  = "Simple Root CA"
commonName              = "Simple Root CA"

[ ca_reqext ]
keyUsage                = critical,keyCertSign,cRLSign
basicConstraints        = critical,CA:true
subjectKeyIdentifier    = hash

# The remainder of the configuration file is used by the openssl ca command.
[7mroot-ca.conf[27m[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K# The CA section defines the locations of CA assets, as well as the policies
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K# applying to the CA.
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K[ ca ]
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[Kdefault_ca              = root_ca               # The default CA section
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K[ root_ca ]
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[Kcertificate             = $dir/ca/$ca.crt       # The CA cert
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[Kprivate_key             = $dir/ca/$ca/private/$ca.key # CA private key
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[Knew_certs_dir           = $dir/ca/$ca           # Certificate archive
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[Kserial                  = $dir/ca/$ca/db/$ca.crt.srl # Serial number file
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[Kcrlnumber               = $dir/ca/$ca/db/$ca.crl.srl # CRL number file
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[Kdatabase                = $dir/ca/$ca/db/$ca.db # Index file
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[Kunique_subject          = no                    # Require unique subject
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[Kdefault_days            = 3652                  # How long to certify for
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[Kdefault_md              = sha1                  # MD to use
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[Kpolicy                  = match_pol             # Default naming policy
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[Kemail_in_dn             = no                    # Add email to cert DN
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[Kpreserve                = no                    # Keep passed DN ordering
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[Kname_opt                = ca_default            # Subject DN display options
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[Kcert_opt                = ca_default            # Certificate display options
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[Kcopy_extensions         = none                  # Copy extensions from CSR
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[Kx509_extensions         = signing_ca_ext        # Default cert extensions
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[Kdefault_crl_days        = 365                   # How long before next CRL
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[Kcrl_extensions          = crl_ext               # CRL extensions
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K# Naming policies control which parts of a DN end up in the certificate and
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K# under what circumstances certification should be denied.
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K[ match_pol ]
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[KdomainComponent         = match                 # Must match 'simple.org'
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[KorganizationName        = match                 # Must match 'Simple Inc'
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[KorganizationalUnitName  = optional              # Included if present
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[KcommonName              = supplied              # Must be present
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K[ any_pol ]
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[KdomainComponent         = optional
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[KcountryName             = optional
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[KstateOrProvinceName     = optional
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[KlocalityName            = optional
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[KorganizationName        = optional
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[KorganizationalUnitName  = optional
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[KcommonName              = optional
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[KemailAddress            = optional
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K# Certificate extensions define what types of certificates the CA is able to
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K# create.
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K[ root_ca_ext ]
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[KkeyUsage                = critical,keyCertSign,cRLSign
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[KbasicConstraints        = critical,CA:true
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[KsubjectKeyIdentifier    = hash
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[KauthorityKeyIdentifier  = keyid:always
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K

:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K

:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[Kprivate_key             = $dir/ca/$ca/private/$ca.key # CA private key
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[Knew_certs_dir           = $dir/ca/$ca           # Certificate archive
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[Kserial                  = $dir/ca/$ca/db/$ca.crt.srl # Serial number file
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[Kcrlnumber               = $dir/ca/$ca/db/$ca.crl.srl # CRL number file
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[Kdatabase                = $dir/ca/$ca/db/$ca.db # Index file
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[Kunique_subject          = no                    # Require unique subject
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[Kdefault_days            = 3652                  # How long to certify for
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[Kdefault_md              = sha1                  # MD to use
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[Kpolicy                  = match_pol             # Default naming policy
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[Kemail_in_dn             = no                    # Add email to cert DN
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[Kpreserve                = no                    # Keep passed DN ordering
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[Kname_opt                = ca_default            # Subject DN display options
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[Kcert_opt                = ca_default            # Certificate display options

:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[Kx509_extensions         = signing_ca_ext        # Default cert extensions

:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[Kcrl_extensions          = crl_ext               # CRL extensions
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K# Naming policies control which parts of a DN end up in the certificate and
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K# under what circumstances certification should be denied.
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K[ match_pol ]
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[KdomainComponent         = match                 # Must match 'simple.org'
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[KorganizationName        = match                 # Must match 'Simple Inc'
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[KorganizationalUnitName  = optional              # Included if present
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[KcommonName              = supplied              # Must be present
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K

[38;1H[K:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HM# It defines the CA's key pair, its DN, and the desired extensions for the CA

[38;1H[K:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HMdefault_md              = sha1                  # MD to use
[38;1H[K:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HMdefault_days            = 3652                  # How long to certify for

[38;1H[K:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HMdatabase                = $dir/ca/$ca/db/$ca.db # Index file

[38;1H[K:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HMnew_certs_dir           = $dir/ca/$ca           # Certificate archive
[38;1H[K:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HMprivate_key             = $dir/ca/$ca/private/$ca.key # CA private key
[38;1H[K:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HMcertificate             = $dir/ca/$ca.crt       # The CA cert
[38;1H[K:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HM[ root_ca ]
[38;1H[K:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HM
[38;1H[K:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HMdefault_ca              = root_ca               # The default CA section
[38;1H[K:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[KorganizationalUnitName  = optional
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[KcommonName              = optional
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[KemailAddress            = optional
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K# Certificate extensions define what types of certificates the CA is able to
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K# create.
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K[ root_ca_ext ]
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[KkeyUsage                = critical,keyCertSign,cRLSign
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[KbasicConstraints        = critical,CA:true
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[KsubjectKeyIdentifier    = hash
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[KauthorityKeyIdentifier  = keyid:always
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K[ signing_ca_ext ]
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[KkeyUsage                = critical,keyCertSign,cRLSign
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[KbasicConstraints        = critical,CA:true,pathlen:0

:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K# the CRL.
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K

[?1049h[22;0;0t[?1h=# Simple Signing CA

# The [default] section contains global constants that can be referred to from
# the entire configuration file. It may also hold settings pertaining to more
# than one openssl command.

[ default ]
ca                      = signing-ca            # CA name
dir                     = .                     # Top dir

# The next part of the configuration file is used by the openssl req command.
# It defines the CA's key pair, its DN, and the desired extensions for the CA
# certificate.

[ req ]
default_bits            = 2048                  # RSA key size
encrypt_key             = yes                   # Protect private key
default_md              = sha1                  # MD to use
utf8                    = yes                   # Input is UTF-8
string_mask             = utf8only              # Emit UTF-8 strings
prompt                  = no                    # Don't prompt for DN
distinguished_name      = ca_dn                 # DN section
req_extensions          = ca_reqext             # Desired extensions

[ ca_dn ]
0.domainComponent       = "org"
1.domainComponent       = "simple"
organizationName        = "Simple Inc"
organizationalUnitName  = "Simple Signing CA"
commonName              = "Simple Signing CA"

[ ca_reqext ]
keyUsage                = critical,keyCertSign,cRLSign
basicConstraints        = critical,CA:true,pathlen:0
subjectKeyIdentifier    = hash

# The remainder of the configuration file is used by the openssl ca command.

:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K# applying to the CA.
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K[ ca ]
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[Kdefault_ca              = signing_ca            # The default CA section

:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[Kdefault_days            = 730                   # How long to certify for
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[Kdefault_md              = sha1                  # MD to use
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[Kpolicy                  = match_pol             # Default naming policy
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[Kemail_in_dn             = no                    # Add email to cert DN
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[Kpreserve                = no                    # Keep passed DN ordering
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[Kname_opt                = ca_default            # Subject DN display options
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[Kcert_opt                = ca_default            # Certificate display options
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[Kcopy_extensions         = copy                  # Copy extensions from CSR
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[Kx509_extensions         = email_ext             # Default cert extensions
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[Kdefault_crl_days        = 7                     # How long before next CRL
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[Kcrl_extensions          = crl_ext               # CRL extensions
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K# Naming policies control which parts of a DN end up in the certificate and
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K# under what circumstances certification should be denied.
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K[ match_pol ]
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[KdomainComponent         = match                 # Must match 'simple.org'
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[KorganizationName        = match                 # Must match 'Simple Inc'
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[KorganizationalUnitName  = optional              # Included if present
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[KcommonName              = supplied              # Must be present
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K

:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[KstateOrProvinceName     = optional
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[KlocalityName            = optional
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[KorganizationName        = optional
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[KorganizationalUnitName  = optional
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[KcommonName              = optional
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[KemailAddress            = optional
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K# Certificate extensions define what types of certificates the CA is able to
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K# create.
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K[ email_ext ]

:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[KbasicConstraints        = CA:false

:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[KsubjectKeyIdentifier    = hash
:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[KauthorityKeyIdentifier  = keyid:always

[38;1H[K:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HM# under what circumstances certification should be denied.
[38;1H[K:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HM# Naming policies control which parts of a DN end up in the certificate and
[38;1H[K:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HM
[38;1H[K:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HMcrl_extensions          = crl_ext               # CRL extensions

[38;1H[K:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HMx509_extensions         = email_ext             # Default cert extensions

[38;1H[K:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HMname_opt                = ca_default            # Subject DN display options
[38;1H[K:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HMpreserve                = no                    # Keep passed DN ordering
[38;1H[K:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HMemail_in_dn             = no                    # Add email to cert DN
[38;1H[K:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HMpolicy                  = match_pol             # Default naming policy
[38;1H[K:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HMdefault_md              = sha1                  # MD to use
[38;1H[K:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HMdefault_days            = 730                   # How long to certify for
[38;1H[K:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HMunique_subject          = no                    # Require unique subject
[38;1H[K:[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HMdatabase                = $dir/ca/$ca/db/$ca.db # Index file

[K[K[K[K[K[K[K[K[K[K[K[K[K[K[K[Kemail.conf 
[?1049h[22;0;0t[?1h=# Email certificate request

# This file is used by the openssl req command. Since we cannot know the DN in
# advance the user is prompted for DN information.

[ req ]
default_bits            = 2048                  # RSA key size
encrypt_key             = yes                   # Protect private key
default_md              = sha1                  # MD to use
utf8                    = yes                   # Input is UTF-8
string_mask             = utf8only              # Emit UTF-8 strings
prompt                  = yes                   # Prompt for DN
distinguished_name      = email_dn              # DN template
req_extensions          = email_reqext          # Desired extensions

[ email_dn ]

# Email certificate request

# This file is used by the openssl req command. Since we cannot know the DN in
# advance the user is prompted for DN information.

[ req ]
default_bits            = 2048                  # RSA key size
encrypt_key             = yes                   # Protect private key
default_md              = sha1                  # MD to use
utf8                    = yes                   # Input is UTF-8
string_mask             = utf8only              # Emit UTF-8 strings
prompt                  = yes                   # Prompt for DN
distinguished_name      = email_dn              # DN template
req_extensions          = email_reqext          # Desired extensions

[ email_dn ]
0.domainComponent       = "1. Domain Component         (eg, com)      "
1.domainComponent       = "2. Domain Component         (eg, company)  "
2.domainComponent       = "3. Domain Component         (eg, pki)      "
organizationName        = "4. Organization Name        (eg, company)  "
organizationalUnitName  = "5. Organizational Unit Name (eg, section)  "
commonName              = "6. Common Name              (eg, full name)"
commonName_max          = 64
emailAddress            = "7. Email Address            (eg, name@fqdn)"
emailAddress_max        = 40

keyUsage                = critical,digitalSignature,keyEncipherment
extendedKeyUsage        = emailProtection,clientAuth
subjectKeyIdentifier    = hash
subjectAltName          = email:move

[?1049h[22;0;0t[?1h=# TLS server certificate request

# This file is used by the openssl req command. The subjectAltName cannot be
# prompted for and must be specified in the SAN environment variable.

[ default ]
SAN                     = DNS:yourdomain.tld    # Default value

[ req ]
default_bits            = 2048                  # RSA key size
encrypt_key             = no                    # Protect private key
default_md              = sha1                  # MD to use
utf8                    = yes                   # Input is UTF-8
string_mask             = utf8only              # Emit UTF-8 strings
prompt                  = yes                   # Prompt for DN
distinguished_name      = server_dn             # DN template
req_extensions          = server_reqext         # Desired extensions

[ server_dn ]
0.domainComponent       = "1. Domain Component         (eg, com)      "
1.domainComponent       = "2. Domain Component         (eg, company)  "
2.domainComponent       = "3. Domain Component         (eg, pki)      "
organizationName        = "4. Organization Name        (eg, company)  "
organizationalUnitName  = "5. Organizational Unit Name (eg, section)  "
commonName              = "6. Common Name              (eg, FQDN)     "
commonName_max          = 64

[ server_reqext ]
keyUsage                = critical,digitalSignature,keyEncipherment
extendedKeyUsage        = serverAuth,clientAuth
subjectKeyIdentifier    = hash
subjectAltName          = $ENV::SAN
[7mserver.conf (END)[27m[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K[K[7m(END)[27m[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K[K[7m(END)[27m[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KBB[K[K[7m(END)[27m[K[K # TLS server certificate request

# This file is used by the openssl req command. The subjectAltName cannot be
# prompted for and must be specified in the SAN environment variable.

[ default ]
SAN                     = DNS:yourdomain.tld    # Default value

[ req ]
default_bits            = 2048                  # RSA key size
encrypt_key             = no                    # Protect private key
default_md              = sha1                  # MD to use
utf8                    = yes                   # Input is UTF-8
string_mask             = utf8only              # Emit UTF-8 strings
prompt                  = yes                   # Prompt for DN
distinguished_name      = server_dn             # DN template
req_extensions          = server_reqext         # Desired extensions

[ server_dn ]
0.domainComponent       = "1. Domain Component         (eg, com)      "
1.domainComponent       = "2. Domain Component         (eg, company)  "
2.domainComponent       = "3. Domain Component         (eg, pki)      "
organizationName        = "4. Organization Name        (eg, company)  "
organizationalUnitName  = "5. Organizational Unit Name (eg, section)  "
commonName              = "6. Common Name              (eg, FQDN)     "
commonName_max          = 64

[ server_reqext ]
keyUsage                = critical,digitalSignature,keyEncipherment
extendedKeyUsage        = serverAuth,clientAuth
subjectKeyIdentifier    = hash
subjectAltName          = $ENV::SAN

writing new private key to 'certs/simple.org.key'
-----
You are about to be asked to enter information that will be incorporated
into your certificate request.
What you are about to enter is what is called a Distinguished Name or a DN.
There are quite a few fields but you can leave some blank
For some fields there will be a default value,
If you enter '.', the field will be left blank.
-----
1. Domain Component         (eg, com)       []:org
2. Domain Component         (eg, company)   []:simple
3. Domain Component         (eg, pki)       []:
4. Organization Name        (eg, company)   []:SImp   imple Inco 
5. Organizational Unit Name (eg, section)   []:
6. Common Name              (eg, FQDN)      []:www.simple.org
